September 9, 1990: Fiction
MEMORIES OF MIDNIGHT, by Sidney Sheldon. (Morrow, $21.95.) The destiny of
an American woman is haunted by a cunning, vengeful Greek tycoon.
THE BURDEN OF PROOF, by Scott Turow. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $22.95.) An
attorney tries to unravel the mystery of his wife's death while defending his
wheeler-dealer brother-in-law.
THE WOMEN IN HIS LIFE, by Barbara Taylor Bradford. (Random House, $21.95.)
The rise of a billionaire tycoon, from Nazi Berlin to London and New York, and his
relationships with five women.
MESSAGE FROM NAM, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $21.95.) A woman
journalist's coming of age in the 1960's and 70's.
THE STAND, by Stephen King. (Doubleday, $24.95.) Doomsday brings horrors to
America; the uncut version of a novel first published in 1978.
OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO! by Dr. Seuss. (Random House, $12.95.) The
problems of finding your way through life; in verse and pictures.
SEPTEMBER, by Rosamunde Pilcher. (Dunne/St. Martin's, $22.95.) Guests from
many parts of the world at a get-together in a small Scottish town.
COYOTE WAITS, by Tony Hillerman. (HarperCollins, $19.95.) The murder of a
Navajo tribal policeman involves an ancient artifact.
GET SHORTY, by Elmore Leonard. (Delacorte, $18.95.) A Miami crook goes to
Hollywood, where he finds that his life is the stuff of which motion pictures are
made.
SEVENTH HEAVEN, by Alice Hoffman. (Putnam, $19.95.) A divorced woman with
children creates waves in a stuffy suburban town in the 1950's.
HAMMERHEADS, by Dale Brown. (Donald I. Fine, $19.95.) A Coast Guard unit
wages war against the South American drug cartel.
STARDUST, by Robert B. Parker. (Putnam, $18.95.) A host of problems besets
the private eye Spenser when he protects a glamorous star.
KILLING MISTER WATSON, by Peter Matthiessen. (Random House, $21.95.)
How the career of a turn-of-the-century Florida plantation owner evolved into an
enduring legend.
AN INCONVENIENT WOMAN, by Dominick Dunne. (Crown, $19.95.) Manners,
morals and murder in Los Angeles's high society.
THE BOURNE ULTIMATUM, by Robert Ludlum. (Random House, $21.95.) Jason
September 9, 1990
Non-Fiction
TRUMP: Surviving at the Top, by Donald J. Trump with Charles Leerhsen.
(Random House, $21.95.) The New York entrepreneur reflects on his recent
experiences.
YOU JUST DON'T UNDERSTAND, by Deborah Tannen. (Morrow, $18.95.) The
different languages men and women speak.
THE POLITICS OF RICH AND POOR, by Kevin Phillips. (Random House,
$19.95.) How the rich got richer during the 1980's.
MEN AT WORK, by George F. Will. (Macmillan, $19.95.) The political pundit and
baseball buff describes the craft of the game.
EVERY SPY A PRINCE, by Dan Raviv and Yossi Melman. (Jaffe/Houghton Mifflin,
$24.95.) A history of the Israeli intelligence community.
DARKNESS VISIBLE, by William Styron. (Random House, $15.95.) The novelist's
memoir of a period of severe depression.
DAVE BARRY TURNS 40, by Dave Barry. (Crown, $16.95.) Thoughts about the
crises of middle age from the syndicated humorist.
BARBARIANS AT THE GATE, by Bryan Burrough and John Helyar. (Harper
Collins, $22.95.) The 1988 battle for control of RJR Nabisco.
TOM LANDRY, by Tom Landry with Gregg Lewis. (Zondervan/HarperCollins,
$18.95.) The autobiography of the former football coach.
A NATURAL HISTORY OF THE SENSES, by Diane Ackerman. (Random House,
$19.95.) How the five senses affect our lives.
DON'T SHOOT, IT'S ONLY ME, by Bob Hope with Melville Shavelson. (Putnam,
$19.95.) The comedian reminisces about his career.
INSIDE JOB, by Stephen Pizzo, Mary Fricker and Paul Muolo. (McGraw-Hill,
$19.95.) How America's savings and loans were looted of billions of dollars.
MEGATRENDS 2000, by John Naisbitt and Patricia Aburdene. (Morrow, $21.95.)
Prognostications for the next decade.
CAPTAIN SIR RICHARD FRANCIS BURTON, by Edward Rice. (Scribners, $35.)
The strange and remarkable career of the British explorer.
HIT MEN, by Fredric Dannen. (Times Books/Random House, $19.95.) The
evolution of the modern pop-music record industry.
FATHER, SON & CO., by Thomas J. Watson Jr. and Peter Petre. (Bantam,
